body: --- ## **Description** The current footer is minimal but lacks visual appeal and functional enhancements. It feels too plain, has limited content organization, and does not make full use of the available space for navigation and branding. --- ## **Problems Identified** - Very basic design with minimal styling. - Lacks visual hierarchy ‚Äî all text appears similar in weight and color. - Limited section separation ‚Äî navigation links are not clearly grouped. - No clear call-to-action or interactive elements apart from links. - Minimal brand identity presence ‚Äî the footer could better represent the product‚Äôs personality. - Limited responsiveness and spacing on smaller screens. --- ## **Proposed Improvements** - **Improve visual styling** with better typography, spacing, and section separation. - Group navigation links into clear categories for better usability. - Add subtle background color or divider line for better section distinction. - Include brand tagline, mission statement, or a short description to strengthen brand identity. - Enhance the theme toggle UI to blend more naturally with the design. - Add hover effects to links and icons for better interactivity. - Ensure full **responsive design** for mobile and tablet views. - Optionally, include social media links, newsletter signup, or quick contact options. --- ## **Tech Stack** - **HTML5** ‚Äì Semantic structure for better accessibility. - **CSS3** ‚Äì Flexbox/Grid for layout, hover effects, and responsiveness. - **JavaScript (Optional)** ‚Äì Smooth theme switching, interactive elements. --- ## **Expected Outcome** - A **modern, well-structured footer** that is visually appealing. - Clear navigation with grouped links for better UX. - Stronger brand presence and better use of available space. - Fully responsive layout across devices. @subh05sus I am OSCI contributor , and want to work on this issue , please assign it to me.
title: [UI]  UI Enhancement: Improve Footer Design and Functionality

body: ### üéØ What‚Äôs the suggestion? Refine the landing page‚Äôs visual hierarchy, contrast ratios, and call-to-action flow to reduce unnecessary cognitive load, improve scannability, and align with WCAG accessibility standards. This involves: - Increasing text-to-background contrast in key messaging areas. - Aligning interactive elements with their contextual text to strengthen information grouping (Gestalt principles). - Establishing a single, dominant primary CTA for first-time visitors to optimize decision-making flow. ### üëÄ What‚Äôs wrong with the current version? - **Fragmented Attention Flow** ‚Üí ‚ÄúLogin with GitHub‚Äù in the top-right and ‚ÄúAI Connect is Live‚Äù in the center compete for attention, making it unclear which is the primary action. - **Contrast & Accessibility Gap** ‚Üí The ‚ÄúMake Connections strong‚Äù section has insufficient visual weight and borderline WCAG AA contrast levels, reducing readability. - **Disconnected Interactive Element** ‚Üí The ‚Äústrong‚Äù button feels visually detached from its headline, breaking typographic continuity. - **Whitespace Imbalance** ‚Üí Excess vertical gap between tagline and hero section creates a ‚Äúdead zone‚Äù that interrupts scanning flow.
title: Optimizing Landing Page Visual Hierarchy, Contrast Ratios, and CTA Flow for Enhanced Cognitive Load Management & Accessibility Compliance
